subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_018F_01C9D933.D74395E0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not=
 quite ready to believe that one right yet)." 

I don't know for sure about=
 that one either, but I am not ready to discount it either, especially sinc=
e I stumbled across the possibility of audible scrying. But I am sure alot =
of people don't believe in scrying at all either.

What makes it a possibil=
ity to me is that so many people are hearing things that are very personal,=
 but stuff they would not have come up with on their own.


  ----- Origina=
l Message ----- 
  From: Eric VanDuzer 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Se=
nt: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a =
question.





  I think that is the problem I am having though Jim.  When =
you say "work them over till you hear them"  to me I should not have to wor=
k them over till I hear them.  Yes taking out the ambient and background no=
ise is one thing.  But if you just keep on listening to them with different=
 enhancements you are bound to hear something (matrixing).  If one person i=
s not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to =
believe that one right yet).  I think you all know what I am getting at.  
=



  On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@...=
m> wrote:




    Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much becaus=
e I really don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it =
for a couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you can FIND=
 what was there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot more than=
 others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone is able=
 to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is correct)Pretty=
 BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it up with better software (p=
lease do for others too) I will be more than happy to "listen" where I made=
 a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhancements=
 to a few of my evp's...from the begining I could only hear clicks and thum=
ps.....but after messing with that area, eventually I would hear the true v=
oices (and can tell if male or female...approximate age) and understand the=
 mood also....these where extreamly modified, and I feel that I could NOT h=
ave added enough "simple" enhancements that would ADD a voice....full of em=
otion and distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear them for what ever=
 reason be it equipment that is used to hear (pc-headphones-speakers-ears) =
know one has the perfect match of all these things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR6=
0 EVP's" in the files section....work them over till you hear them. I reall=
y can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Eric VanDuzer <evand=
uzer@...> wrote:
    >
    > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way=
 of doing things. I do clean
    > up evps if I hear something and can't ma=
ke it out do to ambient noise. So
    > hear is my question. When do you st=
op cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
    > enhancing "taint" the results? To me=
 the more enhancing you do the less
    > convincing it becomes. I hope noo=
ne finds this offensive, it is not meant
    > to be I am just really curio=
us. The way I look at it is that if you have to
    > do so much enhancing =
to find anything, was there really something there to
    > begin with. Are=
 we just making ourselves believe there is something there??
    > 
    > E=
ric
    >
